summary: This collection focuses on keeping the web weird, diverse, and innovative. It encourages engagement with ISOC, embracing open-source principles, exploring digital fabrication, and championing digital ownership. The content promotes unconventional thinking, creativity, and the preservation of the internet's quirky nature. It covers topics like open web, funding, maker culture, indie filmmaking, DIY projects, and data ownership. By following these ideas, users can contribute to maintaining a dynamic online space that defies conformity and nurtures individuality.
excerpt: To keep the web weird, engage with ISOC, embrace open-source principles, explore digital fabrication, channel your inner guerrilla filmmaker, and champion digital ownership. These steps promote innovation, creativity, and unconventional thinking.
